headline: Inside Politics
subHeadline: Alex Murdaugh Cross-Examined In His Murder Trail; Murdaugh: "I Never Manufactured Any Alibi" About Murders. Aired 12-12:30p ET

utterances.speaker: CREIGHTON WATERS, PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: After that you'll agree that Maggie's phone around 8

utterances.speaker: ALEX MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Is what the data shows, yes sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Data that shows is correct. That's what it shows. Is that correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That is correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And then you would agree with me that from nano-2 to nano-6, your phone finally comes to life and start showing a lot of steps.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That do agree with it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What were you doing?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I was getting ready to go to my mom's house.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Getting ready to go. I thought to take a shower already. You were just laying down on the couch. What all you need to do to get ready to go to your mom's house?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I mean, there wasn't anything to get ready in that aspect. I was getting ready to go. I was preparing to leave.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Doing what?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know if I got up, went to the bathroom. I don't know. I can't tell you exactly what I was doing.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: 'That's far more steps in a shorter time period than any time prior, as you've seen from the testimony in this case. So, what were you so busy doing? Going to the bathroom?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, no. I don't think that I---

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: To get on a treadmill?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Move to the bathroom. I did not even get on a treadmill.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Jog in place?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't jog in place.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you do jumping jacks?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, I did not do jumping jacks.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What were you doing Mr. Murdaugh for those four months?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Preparing to leave from my mom's house.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What? What does that mean? I mean, you're in the front room on that couch where you say you lay down. The suburban is just right outside. What are you doing?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know, if I got up and went to my room, went to the gun room, went back in that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Doing what? You've been so clear. And your new story about everything. What were you doing during these four minutes?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I disagree with your assertion about every detail. I don't recall. I know that I was getting up. And I was leaving, I was going to check on my mom. That's specifically what I was doing. I don't - I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I know what I wasn't doing, Mr. Waters. And what I wasn't doing is doing anything. As I believe (Inaudible) that I was cleaning off or washing off or washing off guns, putting guns in a raincoat. And I can promise you that I wasn't doing any of that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Also, during this four-minutes where you got 283 steps. Not only are you moving around a lot, but you're making a ton of phone calls because in that same time period, you see this red line right here. Where over that four-minute period, all the steps were taken. That's also when you're calling, making all these phone calls, isn't it Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, I made the phone calls---

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You were making these phone calls, is that what you learn?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You allowed to answer before Mr. Waters steps on him again with another question. Please. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You were making all these phone calls while you were taking all these steps? Would you concede that where you don't remember what you were doing?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, I was making phone calls and that showed here. At 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, no, sir. What I'm saying Mr. was, I don't know that. I'm just giving you an example. You're saying that I'm running around, taking the steps. And while I'm doing that, I'm making telephone calls. What I will agree with is that this data shows that there was 283 steps recorded on my phone. And sometime during that period, I made certain phone calls.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. All right. So not only for whatever it is, is recording steps, you're also making a ton of phone calls, including miss calls to Maggie, who is 1100 feet away.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You're using the term a ton of phone calls. What I agree is that I made the phone calls that are listed on these call data records, which you know, are very normal phone calls from me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Do you know why so many phone calls were missing from the log around this relevant time period when law enforcement downloaded your phone on June 10.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: From my phone?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you delete them Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Not intentionally.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, I did not. And I did not delete phone calls from my phone. Mr. Waters, one of the most important things in this whole thing for me has been getting this data that I believe would exist phone calls and phone records would be part of that.I've been in enough civil cases and used phone records enough times to know that you delete a phone call from your phone, it doesn't disappear. So, I can tell you, this jury and everybody who's listening, that I did not intentionally delete phone calls from my phone.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Because you started talking about your former prosecutor, correct, and former lawyer doing civil cases? We went through that yesterday. And boy, you're busy be on that phone. Right out of the gate and not know, too, right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Am I a busy bee?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And one of the first things you start talking about with law enforcement, is these calls that you made to Maggie, correct? You can't recall that from your first statement to law enforcement.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: One of the first things did I say to law enforcement?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's one of the things you talk about. I'm talking about with your interview with special agent Dave Owens.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't remember that being the first thing we talked about.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: The first things.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If Mr. Owens asked me about it, then I---

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: No, you (Inaudible), you didn't.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You don't recall?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't recall.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Would you dispute me if I said you brought it up.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That I brought up? Brought up what?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Your phone, Mr. Murdaugh, your phone.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Phone calls to Maggie?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Did I brought up phone calls to Maggie to David Owens.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm asking you is that one of the things that you talked about in your first interview with Dave Owens, that you pulled out your phone and started looking at it, that you brought that up? Do you recall that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, but that's not what you asked. Mr. Owens, you asked me was that the first thing that I talked to him about and that was the discrepancy. I certainly don't dispute that Mr. Owens and I talked about phone calls, but that's not what you said. So just to be clear.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well, the real reason, Mr. Murdaugh is that you as a lawyer and prosecutor are up at 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's absolutely incorrect.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So that's just another circumstance and coincidentally in this particular case? Right around the time that you lie to law enforcement about maybe one of the most important facts in the case.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It is absolute fact that I'm not manufacturing an alibi, as you say.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: How do you remember so much detail about everything else, but you don't remember what you were specifically doing to generate 283 steps while you're making these, all these phone calls in the same four-minute period?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I remember unequivocally without any doubt, what is clear a man is I could have at any time that I never manufactured any alibi in any way shape or form. Because I did not and would not hurt my wife and my child. So, I know for a fact did I never ever, ever created an alibi.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Why don't you remember what you were doing when you were so busy for this four-minute critical period?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do remember what I was doing.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Other than I was getting ready to go.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because that's what I was doing.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: There was no reason to.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're making multiple missed calls to Maggie and she's so close and there's a driveway right there. Why do you not just go down there and say, hey guys, I'm heading over there.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It wasn't important to do that. Me making those phone calls is simply me letting - I believe I called Maggie and I believe I called Paul. But that that's simply me just letting them know that I'm leaving for a minute, I'll be back. The fact that that they don't answer is not unusual at all. Now, it is odd. It is unusual that they never call me back.But at that moment, the fact that there's a missed call. When I know they're on the property, I mean, that doesn't even register at all. That's perfectly normal to try to call somebody who's on the property and not be able to get down. And as far as not going down there, there was no sense of urgency. Maggie was with Paul. You know, she should be as safe as she could be.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And she should. Did you talk with Maggie about going to Almeda when you're at the kennels? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you talk with Maggie about going to Almeda during supper?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I know that we had talked about it. I had talked. I don't believe we talked about it at supper, but we may have. I noticed I had talked about that I was going to go over there. And then I decided that I wasn't going to go over that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So, what was your conversation of supper. Tell me specifically because now I'm going to Almeda?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I can't tell you that we specifically talked about. The only thing that I can tell you we specifically talked about at supper was Paul-Paul.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And what was the conversation?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Maggie was just concerned, Paul-Paul had been having for young person. Paul have been having high blood pressure. And he's very resistant to go to the doctor and just been going on for a little while. But lately Paul's feet have swollen and for 22-year-old have stuck to having swollen feet concern both of us. And it particularly concerned Maggie and we talked about that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. You don't talk about Mr. Randolph at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm sure we did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Do you remember that group texts coming in about whether or not anybody was going to go see Mr. Randolph at the hospital the next day?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Do I remember it coming in? I don't remember it coming in.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Because you didn't read it till the next day.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I've seen the data.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Why didn't you - did you ever text the group and say you're going to Almeda at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did Maggie ever - did you and Maggie ever specifically discuss her going along with you to Almeda?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that we did. I know that. There was a point in time where I said Maggie might go but if, Holly, unusual for Maggie to go in visit just my mom. That whole situation, it just made - it made Maggie sad. And she didn't like to go.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You aren't?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that we did. But I do acknowledge that at some point, I said she might go for some reason. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did say that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And you also said that you came to find out that she came home of her own accord, correct? You told that to law enforcement, is that true?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: She did come home of her own accord.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That she decided on her own to come home because she was worried about you, didn't know what you said?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did say that, and I believe that to be the case.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. But since we've - despite what you told law enforcement, we've since seen the text that you actually call her and asked her to come home on the night of June 7.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, that's not correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That's not correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, that's absolutely not correct.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe that's what Marian said.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And your defense but in this exhibit, exhibit 107, where Maggie texted block and said Alex wants me to come home.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I've seen that, and I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Is not enough on the screen. I've got the wrong input here. I'll just hold it up. You've seen this text?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I have seen that. Mr. Waters, the only dispute I have with what you're saying is you're saying that I called Maggie and wanted her to come home. I've always wanted Maggie to come home. And I would have talked to Maggie about coming home before she ever left to go to Charleston into Edisto. And I can tell you this. And I didn't realize this at the time. But I realized that now that Maggie was already undecided, but now I didn't know this, but Maggie was already undecided about staying at Edisto.I can promise you that because Bubba and Grady were in their kennels, as you all well know. That night, if - that day, if Maggie was certain that she was spending the night at Edisto, at a minimum, Bubba would have been with her and probably both dogs would have been with her. It was very unusual for her to spend a night anywhere without one of us or those dogs. So, that tells me that when she left that morning, she was already seriously thinking about coming back.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So, you're saying that you never called her and had a conversation that day asking her to come home, specifically on the night of June 7, 2021?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Maggie and I had a couple of phone conversations that day. What I'm telling you is that before she left - no, I don't believe we had a phone call about that we may have discussed during the phone call, but I didn't make a phone call to her to ask her to come home. I had already told her I wanted her to come home. I always wanted her to come home. You heard Marian say that too, that I always wanted Maggie with me.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Maggie thought enough having to talk about it with Marian?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The fact that I wanted her to come home?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: We'll share. I mean, as what Marian said.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So, you're denying that you called Maggie and specifically asked her to come home that night?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I didn't make a phone call to Maggie to ask her to come home that night. I asked Maggie to come home long before she ever left. And I probably asked her again each time I talked to her, but I didn't make the phone call specifically for that as you're saying. And to be clear, I'm certain that of Maggie was certain that she was spending the night. Bubba would have been with her and probably Grady.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Why didn't you tell law enforcement that that you found out after the fact that Maggie wanted to come home because she was concerned about you? Why don't you phrase it that way? If what you're saying to the jury now was accurate. Why would you phrase it that way?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because I believe that to be the case.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That you found out afterwards, but now you're saying you knew.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I'm saying I found out afterwards while she came home, Mr. Waters. And she came home because she was worried about. So, I want to be clear about that. I did not learn that until I think the day after she got killed.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: But you're saying that you found out that after the fact that you're telling this jury that you knew the things that you just said about her wanting to come home. And you were unaware of what Marian would say at that point either?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You would agree with me that you sent a text to Maggie at 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do, which was because I couldn't reach them by the telephone, and I wanted him to know where I was, which is what we do.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And you got to Almeda around 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I believe that's correct. I don't have any reason to dispute that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You made some more phone calls along the way?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did make more phone calls along the way while I was riding.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You called Chris Wilson?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did call Chris Wilson.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You had a short conversation with him. Is that right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did have a conversation for however long the record show.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: About 131 seconds, that sound about, right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: If that's what the record show two minutes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You called your brother John Marvin for about 106 seconds encoding connection time. Does that sound about right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It does sound about right.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You arrived at 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It does.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And then at 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That is correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And then you went inside, is that right? MURDAUGH

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Talked Miss. Shelley?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's right. I called the house phone to get Shelley---

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Take you straight back to the courtroom Walterboro, South Carolina, Alex Murdaugh on the stand day two cross examination.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I don't think - I don't think your assertion is accurate. You have to understand this on August the 11th when I went to meet with David Owens, and in that David Owens, asked me about - he showed me that Snapchat and asked me about clothes that I had on. And shortly after that, the next time I was with Blanca. I asked Blanca about those clothes, because David Owens had asked me about him, it was make - made an issue about it.And so, I checked with Blanca to see what I specifically asked Blanca and it was an issue to me. So, I got blocked and I said, I need you to sit down talk with me about this. This is important. Do you remember my clothes when you came to Moselle that day, and she remembered exactly what she testified to, she remembered that my pants were there. She wasn't sure if the shirt was there. At that time, I think she actually thought the shirt was there, but she was clear that she wasn't sure about that. But, no, no, she wasn't - but she didn't remember, but I assumed that it was. So, that was the conversation that and while I was asking Banca

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Well again, a very specific about your memories of that conversation. Is that correct, Mr. Murdaugh?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You're doing right. I'm consistent about that because a very short time before that, David Owens is asking me questions, and telling me I'm a suspect in the murder of my wife and my child and asking me about my clothes. You dang, right, it was important.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: It was important, right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And you dang right, I remember what - why went to her and for what reason?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Does the only thing you're concerned about is yourself. You're not concerned about giving accurate information to law enforcement, correct. What's the reason for that, Mr. Murdaugh? Why don't you want to give accurate information to law enforcement? Why do you want to talk to these women who both are employed by you or your family and try to influence what they are going to say?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I didn't want to give law enforcement accurate information. I told a lie about being down there and I got myself wet to that. But I wanted to give them as much I knew that I hadn't done this, and I wanted to give them as much accurate information as I could. But the reason I went to Blanca is specifically because David Owens talking to me on August the 11th.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. You can see that you're underway about 9

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You turn on Moselle about 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Turn into Moselle at 10

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Looks to me like I turned into Moselle at 10 o'clock.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: 10 o'clock on the dot, that's right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: At the house at 10

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: And that's when you went back to the kennel after you came back from Almeda, correct?
